author: Admin Martin
title: Arsenal star insists he is enjoying the preferred role Arteta has picked for him
text:
Riccardo Calafiori joined Arsenal following an outstanding season playing as a central defender for Bologna, a role he also excelled in for the Italy national team during Euro 2024. His impressive performances in the tournament caught the attention of Arsenal, who moved decisively to secure his signature in the last transfer window.
Calafiori arrived at the Emirates as one of the most highly regarded left-footed centre-backs in Europe, a player capable of adding balance and versatility to Arsenal’s defence. However, since his arrival, he has primarily been deployed as a left-back, a position he has embraced with enthusiasm despite being more accustomed to playing centrally.
The unshakeable partnership of Gabriel Magalhaes and William Saliba at the heart of Arsenal’s defence has made it difficult for Calafiori to claim a spot in the middle. Nevertheless, the Italian has adjusted to his new role with professionalism and determination, earning admiration from fans and coaches alike.
Speaking to Gianluca di Marzio , Calafiori explained his outlook on adapting to a new position:
“I have certainly made a name for myself as a centre-back but the coach also sees me as a left-back and I am here to become a top player, honestly.
“I want to be at a high level in both roles, both as a centre-back and as a full-back and maybe even in another role! I am here to learn and I certainly think that the way we play, the role of full-back suits me very well.”
Calafiori’s attitude has been a key factor in his growing popularity among Arsenal fans. His willingness to adapt, coupled with his strong work ethic, has made him a valuable member of the squad. Whenever he steps onto the pitch in an Arsenal shirt, the Italian gives his all and delivers performances of the highest standard.
As the season progresses, Calafiori’s versatility and positive mindset will continue to benefit Arsenal, allowing the team to remain competitive across multiple competitions. His ability to excel in different positions adds a new dimension to the squad and demonstrates his commitment to reaching the very top of the game.

author: Redazione Notizie.it
title: Doppio dramma a Treviso: dalla tragedia alla disperazione
text:
Un dramma inaspettato ha colpito la provincia di Treviso, lasciando tutti senza parole. La tragica morte di un giovane ha scatenato una reazione devastante da parte del suo compagno di vita, un episodio che mette in luce la fragilità delle relazioni umane e il peso della disperazione. Scopriamo insieme i dettagli di questa terribile vicenda, un racconto che sembra uscito da un film, ma che purtroppo è realtà.
Il tragico incidente di Kevin Anghele
Kevin Anghele, un ragazzo di soli 23 anni originario di Pordenone, ha perso la vita in un incidente stradale che ha lasciato sgomenti amici e familiari. La notte tra lunedì e martedì, Kevin ha tentato di sfuggire a un posto di blocco dei carabinieri, intraprendendo una corsa ad alta velocità in un atto disperato. Purtroppo, il suo veicolo ha perso il controllo, ribaltandosi più volte e schiantandosi contro un albero. I soccorritori non sono riusciti a salvarlo. Ma chi era realmente Kevin? La sua vita era segnata da tensioni familiari. Il giovane aveva scelto di allontanarsi dalla casa materna, dove viveva con la madre e il patrigno, un uomo bosniaco di 43 anni. Questo cambiamento non era solo una ricerca di indipendenza, ma anche il tentativo di sfuggire a un rapporto difficile. Kevin si era trasferito a Pordenone, dove condivideva un appartamento con un amico, cercando di ricostruire la propria esistenza. Ma cosa si nascondeva dietro il suo sorriso?
Dalla tragedia alla disperazione: il suicidio del patrigno
La vicenda si complica ulteriormente con il drammatico gesto del patrigno di Kevin, che ha deciso di togliersi la vita poche ore dopo aver appreso della morte del giovane. Questo secondo colpo di scena ha lasciato la comunità in uno stato di shock. L’uomo è stato trovato privo di vita nella propria abitazione, un gesto che nessuno avrebbe potuto prevedere. Secondo le prime indagini, il patrigno non avrebbe lasciato alcun messaggio, rendendo ancora più misteriose le ragioni che lo hanno spinto a compiere un atto così estremo. I rapporti tra lui e Kevin erano notoriamente tesi e, dopo la morte del giovane, la disperazione deve aver preso il sopravvento. Ma quali erano i veri motivi di questa tragica spirale? È una domanda che rimane senza risposta, mentre la comunità si interroga su come la vita possa cambiare così drasticamente in pochi attimi.
Le ombre del passato e le conseguenze tragiche
Esaminando la vita di Kevin, emergono dettagli inquietanti. Durante l’incidente, le forze dell’ordine hanno trovato nel veicolo alcuni panetti di hashish e materiale per il confezionamento delle dosi, suggerendo un possibile coinvolgimento nel traffico di stupefacenti. Questo non è stato il primo problema legale per il giovane, noto alle autorità per precedenti legati alla guida in stato di ebbrezza, che gli era costata la patente. La vita di Kevin era quindi segnata da scelte sbagliate e relazioni complesse, che hanno portato a un epilogo tragico. La sua morte e quella del patrigno ci ricordano che dietro ogni faccia che incontriamo possono nascondersi storie di dolore e conflitti irrisolti. Una storia che suscita emozioni forti e ci invita a riflettere su come ogni scelta possa avere conseguenze inaspettate e devastanti.
Questa vicenda ci lascia con molte domande e un profondo senso di tristezza. È fondamentale ricordare che la vita è fragile e che, spesso, dietro a un’apparente normalità si nascondono sofferenze inimmaginabili. Se conosci qualcuno che sta attraversando un momento difficile, non esitare a offrire il tuo aiuto: a volte, una semplice parola può fare la differenza. Non dimentichiamo che la connessione umana è essenziale, specialmente nei momenti più bui.

author: Deidre Johnson
title: Why it's important for women to get preventive care | kgw.com
text: PORTLAND, Ore. — Dr. Amy Cantor, associate professor at [OHSU](https://www.ohsu.edu/womens-health), says it's not enough for women to go to the doctor when they're in pain — they've got to go before there's an issue and get regular check-ups. It's called preventive care. "It's important for women to understand that access to preventive services and understanding preventive services can help them detect diseases early, screen for conditions," Cantor said. Cantor said those conditions are mostly determined by a woman's age, risk factors and exposure. For instance, Cantor said, "When you're coming to your doctor in your twenties, there are certain services that you're eligible for, such as screening for cervical cancer, screening for sexually transmitted infections." As women get older, there are certain screenings that are important depending on the decade of life. "Lots of women have questions about breast cancer, about screening for osteoporosis and bone disease, about screening for colon cancer. These are all important for women to ask their doctors about," she said. RELATED: [US maternal deaths more than doubled over two decades in unequal proportions for race and geography](/article/news/nation-world/us-maternal-deaths-2023-study/507-9549b7a6-54b8-4465-81b7-ca500808373e) Regardless of age, women can get those screenings without paying anything out of pocket. "What I mean by eligible is they're covered under the Affordable Care Act, and women can go on websites such as [healthcare.gov](https://www.healthcare.gov/) or [womenspreventivehealth.org](http://Womenspreventivehealth.org) to look at the type of services you're eligible for," Cantor said. Cantor added that while it's important for everyone to get preventive care, some women face barriers to healthcare. "There are huge disparities in the outcomes for women. We see this in the maternal mortality outcome. We see this in the rate of cancer treatment and access to services," Cantor said. Dr. Cantor says it doesn't matter your age, race or socioeconomic status; all women should have the opportunity to get the care they need. She added that it's important for women to speak up and advocate for themselves — if you feel like something is wrong or doesn't feel quite right with your body, let your doctor know. Cantor says your doctor can then order more tests to find out what's going on. For more information, you can check out [OHSU's Center for Women's Health](https://www.ohsu.edu/womens-health).

author: Courtney Anderson
title: Bystander shot after fight at South Memphis apartment: MPD
text: MEMPHIS, Tenn. — A Memphis man is in custody after a bystander was shot at a South Memphis apartment complex, police say. Keywon Wilson, 23, has been charged with aggravated assault, reckless endangerment with a deadly weapon, and vandalism. Memphis Police responded to the Longview Heights Apartments on Philsar Street at around 9:49 p.m. on April 27. According to Memphis Police, a woman had been shot at the apartments and taken to Memphis Fire Station #20 by a private vehicle. She was then taken to Regional One Hospital. Memphis Police say the victim told investigators that she had gone outside to smoke a cigarette and saw a fight happening. The victim allegedly told police that she heard gunshots but did not see the shooter. Police say the victim then realized that she had been shot in the abdomen. A neighbor took her to the fire station. According to police, the apartment’s property manager told officers a fight had happened outside a party in one of the apartment buildings. Police say the property manager saw a woman hand Wilson a gun after he asked for it. Memphis Police say Wilson is accused of firing shots at another building. One of the bullets struck the victim. The property manager reportedly told police that the leasing office was also struck and that a computer monitor inside was damaged. Wilson is currently in the Shelby County Jail. His bond has not been set at this time.

Description
43 minutes ago
New Ontario research shows safer opioid supply and methadone programs help people facing addiction. Harm reduction advocates say they're concerned about politics getting in the way, when it's critical people in need continue to have access to the services. Health reporter Katherine Ward has more.

Study shows safer supply reduces overdose risk
Description
43 minutes ago
New Ontario research shows safer opioid supply and methadone programs help people facing addiction. Harm reduction advocates say they're concerned about politics getting in the way, when it's critical people in need continue to have access to the services. Health reporter Katherine Ward has more.

author: Kyle Mantyla
title: Right Wing Round-Up: The Lesser Magistrates
text:
Sky Palma @ Raw Story: Ex-Trump adviser Peter Navarro sentenced to prison for contempt of Congress. Roger Sollenberger @ The Daily Beast: Inside the Shady Finances Behind Mike Johnson’s Longtime Pastor. Charisma Madarang @ Rolling Stone: Trump Says Anyone Who Donates to Haley Is ‘Permanently Banned’ From MAGA. Brian Kaylor and Jeremy Fuzy @ Public Witness: The ‘Lesser Magistrates’ Threat to Democracy. Kevin Drum: Republicans don’t really want to solve the illegal immigration problem. Media Matters: Greg Gutfeld says “it’s now acceptable” to use slur on Fox News.
Former Trump White House adviser Peter Navarro was sentenced Thursday to four months in prison after he was convicted in September of two counts of contempt of Congress for refusing to testify and provide documents to the House Select Committee to Investigate the Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol.
Speaker Mike Johnson’s “dear friend” and longtime pastor has quite the story about his flock turning on him.
The ex-president continued to whine over his rival’s presence in the GOP primaries.
It might be tempting to dismiss a self-published book by an anti-abortion activist who’s been accused of preaching violence, but it’s been praised by then-Kentucky Gov. Matt Bevin and a Republican state lawmaker in Alabama who gave author-signed copies to his colleagues. Michael Flynn, Donald Trump’s disgraced National Security Advisor who helped plot the efforts to overturn the 2020 election and now leads the election-denying Trumpian carnival known as the ReAwaken America Tour, called Trewhella’s book “a masterful blueprint showing Americans how to successfully resist tyranny.”
It’s commonplace for partisans to claim that the other side doesn’t really want to solve a particular problem (racism, abortion, etc.) because they don’t want it to go away as a base-mobilizing issue. Very seldom, however, does the opposition actually confirm that.
“You can say that now. It’s okay. You can say that now.”

author: Freddy Monares
title: Years in the making, Overlook Walk will connect Pike Place to Seattle's waterfront | KNKX Public Radio
text: Is it a park? Is it a bridge? Overlook Walk is both, and a key connection to the waterfront The City of Seattle is set to celebrate the opening of its new walkway that connects Pike Place Market to the waterfront. The Overlook Walk is a 60,000 sq. ft. park that allows people to get from Pike Place Market to the waterfront without dealing with vehicle traffic. The new park features trees and plants that you typically see in the mountains around Seattle. There's different levels of stadium-style seating and a space for a café. Almost anywhere you stand on the walkway provides a great view of Seattle's skyline, Puget Sound and, on a clear day, Mount Rainier. Joy Shigaki is president of Friends of Waterfront Park, which will manage the park. She said she hopes the elevated space brings locals and tourists back to the downtown area. "We need to incentivize people to have a different experience to come back," Shigaki said during a media preview tour on Wednesday. "It's not going to come back in the same way with people in offices, but we are going to come back because people should be able to see themselves in this extraordinary downtown park." Friends of the Waterfront Park partnered with The City of Seattle and Seattle Center on the project. Seattle Center Director Marshall Foster said the space provides an ADA compliant pathway, making it easier for people to get around. "So for all users — all abilities — to connect down between these in a way that the topography of the city has never allowed people to do," Foster said. Angela Brady, director of Seattle's Office of the Waterfront and Civic Projects, said she gets emotional when she talks about the project she's been working on for the past 13 years. All of this got started around the same time her daughter was born. "I'm just really proud of the space that we're building out here for Seattle," Brady said. The project is part of a major overhaul of the city's waterfront. It's being touted as the city's largest collection of civic projects since the 1962 World’s Fair, which brought attractions like the Space Needle. The Overlook Walk is set to open Friday, October 4 at 4:30 p.m. with a celebration that includes music, food, and arts and crafts. KNKX's [Abe Beeson](https://www.knkx.org/people/abe-beeson) will provide the soundtrack for the celebration.

author: FEDPIVAL
title: La competició de Secundària de Pilota a l'Escola corona els seus campions
text:
La competició de Secundària de Pilota a l’Escola corona els seus campions
Més de 300 xics i xiques de 35 centres educatius de tota la Comunitat es donaren cita en la fase final celebrada a Ontinyent
El Poliesportiu Municipal d’Ontinyent va acollir aquest dimecres 11 de juny la fase final de la competició de Secundària de Pilota a l’Escola 2025, amb la qual es va tancar el curs 2024/25 d'aquest programa de la Generalitat Valenciana, desenvolupat a través de la Direcció General de l’Esport en col·laboració amb la FPV.
Més de 300 xics i xiques d’Educació Secundària Obligatòria de centres educatius de les tres províncies de la Comunitat Valenciana es donaren cita a la localitat de la Vall d'Albaida per a disputar les rondes finals d'aquesta competició de raspall repartida en els nivell de Primer Cicle i Segon Cicle, tant en categoria masculina como femenina.
Centres participants
Hi participaren un total de 35 centres: IES García Berlanga de Sant Joan d'Alacant, IES María Blasco de Sant Vicent del Raspeig, IES Joan Coromines de Benicarló, IES Maestrat de Sant Mateu, IES La Foia d'Elx, IES María Moliner de Port de Sagunt, IES Vall de Segó de Benifairó de les Valls, IES Les Rodanes de Vilamarxant, IES Serra Mariola de Muro d'Alcoi, SES La Llosa de Ranes, IES La Canal de Navarrés, IES Escultor Francesc Badia de Foios, Colegio Sagrado Corazón de Meliana, Colegio Santísimo Cristo de la Fe d'Alcàsser, Sant Cristòfor Màrtir de Picassent, IES Enric Valor d'Orba, IES Pedreguer, IES Matemàtic Vicent Caselles de Gata de Gorgos, IES Mediterrània de Benidorm, IES La Nucia, Ramiro Izquierdo Castelló de la Plana, Ntra. Sra. de la Consolación de Vila-real, IES Betxí, IES Gilabert de Centelles de Nules, IES Professor Broch i Llop de Vila-real, Col·legi Hernández de Castelló, IES Càrcer, IES Gregori Maians d'Oliva, CEIP Francesc Carròs de la Font d'En Carròs, Colegio San José de Tavernes de la Valldigna, IES Ausiàs March de Gandia, IES Vall de la Safor de Villalonga, IES Districte Marítim de València, IES Les Foies de Benigànim i IES L'Estació d'Ontinyent.
Campions
Pel que fa al primer cicle (Primer i Segon d'Educació Secundària) el triomf tant en categoria masculina com en la femenina va correspondre a l'IES Les Foies de Benigànim, un habitual en el podi any rere any.
En xics, el subcampió va ser l'IES Enric Valor d'Orba, mentre que el bronze va ser conquistat per l'IES Càrcer, seguit de l'IES Gilabert de Centelles de Nules.
Quant a les xiques, el segon lloc va ser ocupat per l'IES Serra Mariola de Muro d'Alcoi. A la final B, l'IES Enric Valor d'Orba superà a Col·legi Sant Cristòfor Màrtir de Picassent.
Parlant del segon cicle (3r i 4t de l'ESO), l'IES Mediterrània de Benidorm es va fer amb la victòria en categoria masculina, després d'imposar-se en la gran final al SES La Llosa de Ranes. L'IES Vall de la Safor de Vilallonga i el CEIP Francesc Carròs de la Font d'en Carròs es van repartir el tercer i el quart lloc.
Per últim, en categoria femenina, el Colegio Santísimo Cristo de la Fe d'Alcàsser es va corornar com a campió, per davant de l'IES Escultor Francesc Badia de Foios. L'IES Gilabert de Centelles de Nules va ser tercer i l'IES Gregori Maians d'Oliva va signar la quarta posició.
A més a més, durant la jornada es va sortejar un premi consistent en un viatge-visita al Museu de la Pilota del Genovés, el qual va recaure en l'IES Vall de la Safor de Vilallonga.
Declaraciones
El coordinador de pilota de la Generalitat Valenciana, Tino Bendicho, i el regidor d'Esports d'Ontinyent, Ferran Gandia, van acompanyar els jugadors i les jugadores en aquesta fase final.
Per a Tino Bendicho, "la Generalitat Valenciana impulsa el programa de Pilota a l'Escola en col·laboració amb la Federció des de fa quasi 20 anys i és una iniciativa creix any rere any, fins el punt en què ens hem vist en la necessitat de limitar el nombre de centres participants. Aquesta fase final de la competició de Pilota a l'Escola ha sigut una gran festa de la pilota amb més de 300 jugadors i jugadores ací a Ontinyent".
En el curs que conclou, han sigut 937 centres de Primària, Secundària i Formació Professional els que han participat en el programa. En altres paraules, prop de 50.000 xiquets i xiquetes de tota la Comunitat han entrat en contacte amb la pilota gràcies a Pilota a l’Escola.
QUADRE D'HONOR
PRIMER CICLE
Categoria masculina:
1r IES Les Foies de Benigànim
2n IES Enric Valor d'Orba
3r IES Càrcer
4t IES Gilabert de Centelles de Nules
Categoria femenina:
1r IES Les Foies de Benigànim
2n IES Serra Mariola de Muro d'Alcoi
3r IES Enric Valor d'Orba
4t Sant Cristòfor Màrtir de Picassent
SEGON CICLE
Categoria masculina:
1r IES Mediterrània de Benidorm
2n SES La Llosa de Ranes
3r IES Vall de la Safor de Vilallonga
4t CEIP Francesc Carròs de la Font d'en Carròs
Categoria femenina:
1r Colegio Santísimo Cristo de la Fe d'Alcàsser
2n IES Escultor Francesc Badia de Foios
3r IES Gilabert de Centelles de Nules
4t IES Gregori Maians d'Oliva
